snippet: The United States is similar to developing countries in the percentage of mothers who give birth before their child is due, according to the World Health Organization and other agencies.
abstract: World Health Organization and other agencies, in first country-by-country comparison of premature births, say although American hospitals excel at saving premature infants, the United States is similar to developing countries in the percentage of mothers who give birth before their due date; US does worse on this score than any Western European country and considerably worse than Japan or the Scandinavian countries.
lead_paragraph: The United States is similar to developing countries in the percentage of mothers who give birth before their child is due, according to the World Health Organization and other agencies.

headline.seo: U.S. Lags in Global Measure of Premature Births
headline.main: U.S. Lags in Global Measure of Premature Births
headline.print_headline: U.S. Fares Badly In Early Births In Global Study
